sentences.sContent: Maitland, the auctioneer, put up a pair of vases late that afternoon.
sentences.sContent_eng: Maitland, the auctioneer, put up a pair of vases late that afternoon.
sentences.sCn: 那天傍晚，拍买商梅特兰拿出一对花瓶来拍卖。

sentences.sContent: The will was only recently discovered, and is believed to have never been published, an auctioneer told reporters.
sentences.sContent_eng: The will was only recently discovered, and is believed to have never been published, an auctioneer told reporters.
sentences.sCn: 一位拍卖商对记者说，这份遗嘱是最近才发现的，肯定从未公开发表过。

sentences.sContent: The 1895 work is owned by Norwegian businessman Petter Olsen, whose father Thomas was a friend, neighbor and patron of Munch, the auctioneer said on Tuesday.
sentences.sContent_eng: The 1895 work is owned by Norwegian businessman Petter Olsen, whose father Thomas was a friend, neighbor and patron of Munch, the auctioneer said on Tuesday.
sentences.sCn: 据拍卖商周二称，这幅1895年创作的名画为挪威商人皮特•奥尔森所有，他的父亲托马斯是蒙克的朋友、邻居和资助人。

remMethod.val: auction(拍卖) + eer(表人) → 拍卖商

trans.tranOther: someone who is in charge of selling the things at an auction and who calls out how much money has already been offered for something
